question_text: When preparing to clone a failing HDD onto an SSD, which precaution improves the chance of a successful migration?
answer_options: Shrink the partition on the SSD to match the HDD
Disable UEFI boot mode before starting
Create a backup image before attempting a live clone
Perform a low-level format on the source HDD
correct_answer: Create a backup image before attempting a live clone
explanation: If a drive is failing, imaging it first ensures you preserve as much recoverable data as possible before attempting clone operations.
